value.title: Power BI App Navigation

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Patrick walks you through how to get started with a paginated report using Report Builder. In this video, he starts off with how to create an embedded data source, a dataset, and parameters.  To download Report Builder, check out this link: https://guyinacu.be/reportbuilder

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: 4 Ways To Get Data
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Adam looks at 4 ways to get data in Power BI. This focuses on Power BI Desktop and the main storage modes - Import, DirectQuery and Live Connections to Analysis Services. If you are new to Power BI, be sure to check out this Power BI Tutorial: 4 ways to get data.   Import (Excel)

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Sort By A Measure Not Shown In Visual
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Patrick shows you how you can sort by a measure not show in a visual within Power BI Desktop. This was something we didn't even know about until recently and it a great little Power BI nugget. If you wanted to sort by something not shown in a visual, this video is for you!

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: How to Create a Date or Calendar Table and Dimension in Power BI using Power Query
value.excerpt: Date dimension or calendar table is one of the most important dimensions in any BI system. In this video, I'm showing you how easy is to create a date dimension using Power Query. value.title: One Slicer to filter other slicers based on Items that has value only in Power BI without BI Directi
value.excerpt: In a star schema design, how you can filter one dimension by another dimension. How you can find all the products that this customer purchased or all customers who have purchased this product using two separate slicers. To learn more about star schema: https://radacad.com/power-bi-basics-of-modeling-star-schema-and-how-to-build-it

value.title: Previous Dynamic Period using DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Parallel Period is a function that helps you fetching the previous period of a Month, Quarter, or Year. value.title: Write Conditional Statement Using SWITCH in DAX and Power BI
value.excerpt: Conditional expressions are one of the most commonly used expressions in any language as well as DAX. value.title: Computing totals by summing visible values in DAX
value.excerpt: This video shows how to compute a measure that sums the values produced row by row in the visual into the visual total, instead of recomputing the total value in the filter context of the total. Article and download: https://sql.bi/89870

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
